column5: Enough said   Bye bye dude   Enjoy your new environment   Released far away to eat another day
It's a groundhog ??? You don't like the little fella I take it
Careful what you post Jacque... you could do 10 years in jail.. 8 more than if you beat your kids!

No cause he was eating my apples and making a mess out of the back yard    Hiding under the shed.... he wasn't harm in any way but released far away from home   I hear you Wayne... checked with the city before doing anything and basically told us to phone SPCA and a $30.00 dollar fee for pickup and release near by.... they also said that we could do it ourselves.... so bye bye Hector
They have no issues travelling long distance. There is usually a burrow.. or under the shed will do. Mom.. Pop and generally a litter of 5 of so..

Yeah I know    Had 2 of them a couple of years ago and couldn't do anything about it.... tried to trap them but no success     This time fell for a couple of apples that my daughter place inside the cage... was kind of surprise to see that he went for it
They like fresh lettuce....   .. hate Lead.
They always fall for lead with me.....
I had the same problem till recently Jacques.Heard a ruckus in the yard on the weekend Trinity  Was having a bit of fun I wont get into detail, but lets just say. Trinity 1, fur bearin varment 0
He also loved to eat the heads of carrot and beans    Lead was always on my mind but not an option where I live
You not have a pillow you could sacrifice... LOL They always work in the movies....
Good on Trinity
Movies you say LOL  Only thing that comes to mind is Caddy Shack
Did ya try shining a bright light over the shed? Works for Wiarton Willy. One look at his shadow and he runs back into his hole to hide!
Good one pikehunter    May be I should of tried it
aren't they defined as varmints/pests when they do that sort of thing ?   22 usually takes care of the problem.
Ask the guy in Toronto that may do 2 to 10 for beating a raccoon with a shovel for eating his garden Rob. As for part #2 of your post.. YES!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uBpw1sdFu2w
Garden hose down the hole works just fine in the city!

If that guy had been beating a rat with his shovel - nobody would have cared - what's the difference ?     His neighbours just lived too close.  what he should have done is what Leechman did - except he should have tied a brick to that cage - and taken that coon for a swim.

Wish I could of found it.... The shed is sitting on a big rock and no way for digging    he was just going from yard to yard hiding under everyone's sheds    He now has a very large variety of vegetables to choose from at his new location   I know exactly how you feel Rob but not an option where I live
